channel.title: Latest alerts from washingtonpost.com
channel.description: An unofficial feed created by Derek Willis.

item.title: Suspect captured after manhunt following shootings that killed a Democratic Minn. lawmaker and her husband, and wounded two others
item.description: Authorities have detained Vance Boelter, 57, in two shootings. One killed a top Democrat in the state House, Rep. Melissa Hortman, and her husband. Another wounded Democratic state Sen. John Hoffman and his wife.

item.title: J.J. Spaun wins the 125th U.S. Open for the first major title of his career
item.description: Spaun, 34, entered the week having never finished higher than 23rd at a major championship. The Los Angeles native was the only player to finish under par at Oakmont Country Club.

item.title: As floods keep coming, this small city can’t afford to let people leave
item.description: The federal government has long bought the homes of people who live in flood-prone areas. But officials in Barre, Vermont, which had devastating floods in 2023 and 2024, are rejecting applicants because the city can’t afford to lose their tax revenue.

item.title: Was Trump’s Army parade a success? Three columnists weigh in.
item.description: Was Trump’s Army parade a success? Three columnists weigh in.

item.title: Still need to finish this weekend’s On the Record? We’ve got you.
item.description: Play now to finish out your score for the week.

item.title: U.S. officials are investigating a former Syrian official’s claim that American journalist Austin Tice was ordered executed in 2013
item.description: Bassam al-Hassan, a member of Bashar al-Assad’s inner circle, told U.S. investigators in Beirut in April that Assad ordered him to have Tice killed in 2013, according to U.S. officials and other people familiar with the matter.

item.title: The average used-car price hit $30,000. Should you just buy new? Our personal finance columnist weighs in.
item.description: The new-vs.-used-car debate just got complicated thanks to the rising price of pre-owned vehicles. Michelle Singletary explains how to make the best choice.

item.title: Crossword and a coffee: Solve the Sunday puzzle now
item.description: Crossword and a coffee: Solve the Sunday puzzle now

item.title: Authorities probing private security company connections of man suspected in shooting of Minnesota lawmakers
item.description: Authorities have named Vance Boelter, 57, as a suspect in the targeted shootings that killed one state legislator and her husband, and injured another state senator and his wife. Investigators said they are looking into Boelter’s apparent connection to a private security company, which could have given him familiarity with tactics used in the attack, Minnesota Bureau of Criminal Apprehension Superintendent Drew Evans said.

item.title: People are protesting from Philadelphia to Los Angeles ahead of Trump’s military parade in D.C. See the action across the U.S.
item.description: Thousands are gathering in cities across the country for an organized day of protests dubbed “No Kings Nationwide Day of Defiance” against President Donald Trump’s policies. Saturday evening, the nation’s capital will host a parade that celebrates the 250th anniversary of the U.S. Army and falls on Trump’s 79th birthday.

item.title: Trump administration eyes adding dozens of countries to travel ban list, including U.S. partners in Africa, some Caribbean nations
item.description: An internal memo reviewed by The Washington Post sets a 60-day deadline for the targeted governments to conform with certain requirements, or face a full or partial entry ban. Among the new list of countries that could face restrictions are significant U.S. partners such as Egypt and Djibouti, plus countries in the Caribbean, Central Asia and several Pacific Island nations.

item.title: Top Minnesota Democrat killed in ‘politically motivated assassination,’ Gov. Tim Walz says. A manhunt is underway for the suspect.
item.description: State Rep. Melissa Hortman, who recently served as the speaker of the Minnesota House, was shot and killed early Saturday by a gunman impersonating a police officer, authorities said. Another lawmaker was injured in a connected shooting.

item.title: Ninety percent of U.S. adults aren’t eating enough seafood — are you? Here are the healthiest types and what to avoid.
item.description: Studies suggest eating fish is good for your brain, eye and cardiovascular health. Experts recommend that adults eat at least two servings every week, equivalent to about eight ounces.

item.title: How many guesses will Keyword take you today? Try to beat the average now.
item.description: How many guesses will Keyword take you today? Try to beat the average now.

item.title: ‘No buy’ sparks a rebellion against spending. Here’s how you can join.
item.description: ‘No buy’ sparks a rebellion against spending. Here’s how you can join.

item.title: Iran fires ballistic missiles at Israel; explosions heard in Tel Aviv
item.description: Iran said late Friday that its military retaliation against Israel had begun. State media reported that hundreds of ballistic missiles were fired at Israel after the Israeli military launched a wave of strikes against Iranian nuclear and military sites.

item.title: National Portrait Gallery director Kim Sajet steps down, two weeks after Trump claimed to fire her
item.description: The resignation comes days after the Smithsonian said it would review content across its museums, which the White House has slammed as being influenced by "divisive, race-centered ideology."

item.title: Carolyn Hax chat: ‘Star student’ daughter to opt out of college because of AI
item.description: https://www.washingtonpost.com/advice/2025/06/13/live-chat-carolyn-hax/

item.title: Four people escaped from a Newark migrant detention facility, DHS says
item.description: The detainees escaped from Delaney Hall, a privately run detention facility. Protesters faced off with law enforcement there Thursday over conditions at the center, an immigration advocate said.

item.title: What kids wish adults knew about growing up in D.C.
item.description:
The Washington Post asked middle school students to explain, in their words, what it’s like to grow up in the city, and how they feel about crime and their safety. They responded with a mix of joy and despair.
In 2023, crime surged in the District as homicides reached levels not seen in a generation. We set out to find what happened.

item.title: 10 questions, plus a bonus wager! It’s the weekend edition of On the Record.
item.description: Think you’ve got what it takes to earn a perfect score? Take today’s longer news quiz and complete your point total for the week.

item.title: The ‘miracle’ of the sole passenger who survived the Air India flight
item.description: Viswash Kumar Ramesh, on Air India Flight 171 in seat 11A, was the only survivor after the plane crashed in Ahmedabad. An expert called his escape “extraordinary.”

item.title: Israel attacks Iran. Alex Padilla. ‘No Kings’ protests. Crash survivor. Antonio Brown. Extreme rain. Wedding photo. Catch up now.
item.description: Catch up in minutes with these 7 stories.

item.title: Iran launches more than 100 drones in retaliation for Israel’s strikes, according to the Israeli military
item.description: Israel Defense Forces spokesperson Effie Defrin said Friday morning that Iran had launched “over 100 UAVs toward Israel, and the IDF is working to intercept them.” He said Israeli fighter jets had struck over 100 targets across Iran, including the locations of top Iranian military officials, and that the strikes were ongoing.

item.title: Appeals court temporarily allows Trump administration to continue using National Guard in Los Angeles, staying lower court’s order
item.description: The decision by the U.S. Court of Appeals for the 9th Circuit allows President Donald Trump to maintain command of the California National Guard for now and blocks a federal judge’s earlier order to return control of the troops to the state.

item.title: Israeli strikes in Tehran kill the chief commander of Iran's Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps, state media says
item.description: Maj. Gen. Hossein Salami was killed alongside the former head of Iran's Atomic Energy Organization and at least one other senior military officer, Iran's state-run news agency reported.

item.title: Judge blocks Trump administration's use of National Guard in California amid immigration protests
item.description: California had sued to stop the military from being deployed "for law enforcement purposes on the streets of a civilian city." U.S. District Judge Charles R. Breyer ruled Thursday evening that President Donald Trump acted illegally in dispatching the National Guard. Breyer stayed his decision until noon Friday, and the Justice Department immediately filed a notice of appeal.

item.title: Israel strikes Iran, braces for potential retaliation
item.description: Israeli Defense Minister Israel Katz said Israel had launched a “preemptive strike” against Iran and declared a “special emergency situation” in Israel in anticipation of a potential retaliatory attack.

item.title: The Army parade Saturday will bring street closures, security checkpoints, tanks, troops and protests. Here’s what to know.
item.description: The military parade — expected to be the largest in the nation’s capital since the end of the first Gulf War in 1991 — honors the Army's 250th birthday. Saturday is also President Donald Trump’s 79th birthday. We’ve answered some frequently asked questions about the event.

item.title: Sen. Alex Padilla (D-California) forcibly removed from Homeland Security Secretary Noem’s news conference after he interrupted it
item.description: Padilla briefly interrupted Kristi Noem’s news conference in the Los Angeles FBI headquarters, saying he had questions for her. Security pushed him out, telling him to put his hands up.

item.title: At least one passenger survived Air India plane crash with more than 240 people aboard
item.description: Indian Home Minister Amit Shah said he met with the survivor, Vishwash Kumar, who was slightly injured. Kumar told the Hindustan Times that he saw bodies and pieces of the plane all around him after the crash in Ahmedabad.

item.title: Carolyn Hax: After visits to their mom’s, stepkids unleash on their stepmom
item.description: Carolyn Hax: After visits to their mom’s, stepkids unleash on their stepmom

item.title: Harvey Weinstein’s sexual assault retrial in New York ends in mistrial on final charge
item.description: The disgraced Hollywood producer was convicted Wednesday on a separate criminal sex act charge.

item.title: Russia says it’s winning in Ukraine. The data says otherwise.
item.description: Russia has paid an extraordinary price in blood and equipment for marginal gains in Ukraine.

item.title: The late Sly Stone stars in today’s On the Record
item.description: Answer now to earn your Thursday points.

item.title: He’s dying. She’s pregnant. His one last wish is to fight his cancer long enough to see his baby.
item.description: Cancer is no longer just a disease of later life. The rate of new diagnoses for people 50 or older has been falling for two decades. At the same time, it’s been climbing for people under 50. The story of Tanner and Shay Martin captures a growing reality for young cancer patients.

item.title: Nationwide protests. Trump at ‘Les Mis.’ Plane crash. RFK Jr. Brian Wilson. Cancer rates. Dinosaur discovery. Catch up now.
item.description: Catch up in minutes with these 7 stories.

item.title: London-bound passenger plane with more than 200 on board crashes shortly after taking off in India
item.description: Flight AI171, which was headed to Gatwick Airport, had 232 passengers and 12 crew on board, the Associated Press reported. It crashed in Ahmedabad, in India’s Gujarat state, officials said, describing it as a “tragic accident.”

item.title: We asked 1,000 Americans about the L.A. protests. Here's what they said.
item.description: A Washington Post-Schar School poll — including more than 200 California residents — finds Americans are divided in their views toward L.A. protesters and Trump’s decision to send the National Guard and Marines to the city. California residents are more critical of Trump’s actions, as are political independents.

item.title: David Hogg to depart as DNC vice chair after months of turmoil
item.description: The move caps months of party infighting centering on the Gen Z activist’s pledge to involve himself in party primaries and back challengers against some incumbents. Hogg decided not to run to retain his position Wednesday after a Democratic National Committee-wide vote that could have led to his ouster. Last month, a DNC panel found that Hogg and Vice Chair Malcolm Kenyatta were not properly elected earlier this year, since their election ran afoul of gender diversity rules.

item.title: RFK Jr. picks new members of CDC vaccine recommendation panel, including critics of vaccines
item.description: Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. on Wednesday announced eight new members of the Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices after he ousted every member earlier this week. New picks include a longtime member of the nation's oldest anti-vaccine group and at least two critics of coronavirus vaccines.

item.title: U.S. embassies and military bases across the Middle East are on high alert amid fears of an Israeli strike on Iran
item.description: As nuclear negotiations flounder, the State Department authorized the departure of nonessential personnel in Iraq and the Pentagon approved the exit of military family members at U.S. installations across the Middle East.

item.title: EPA moves to weaken limits on power plant emissions, eliminating restrictions on greenhouse gas pollution
item.description: The Environmental Protection Agency announced Wednesday a proposal to eliminate Biden-era regulations restricting power plant greenhouse gas pollution, a move that would significantly increase U.S. emissions that contribute to climate change.

item.title: Harvey Weinstein convicted of sexual assault in New York retrial but acquitted of a rape charge
item.description: The decision comes more than a year after his 2020 conviction for sex crimes was overturned. The jury was expected to continue deliberations on a third charge on Thursday.

item.title: Brian Wilson dies at 82. The Beach Boys co-creator helped make the group the most popular American rock act of the 1960s.
item.description: The band’s early hits — “Surfin’,” “Surfer Girl,” “I Get Around,” “Help Me, Rhonda” and “California Girls,” among others — evoked a world of fast cars, beautiful youth, eternal surf and sunshine on an idyllic and immaculate beach.

item.title: How nuclear war could start
item.description: How nuclear war could start

item.title: Carolyn Hax: After infidelity, boyfriend retaliates with two months of ‘hell’
item.description: Carolyn Hax: After infidelity, boyfriend retaliates with two months of ‘hell’

item.title: FBI leaders seek to move Quantico, Va.'s elite law enforcement training program to Huntsville, Alabama
item.description: The proposal to move the training for state, local and federal law enforcement leaders is part of an ongoing effort by the Trump administration to shrink the FBI's footprint in and around the nation's capital. The training academy for FBI recruits and personnel would stay at Quantico, people familiar with the plans said.

item.title: A chef responds to diner's complaint about $155 for fish
item.description: A chef responds to diner's complaint about $155 for fish

item.title: The biggest cases the Supreme Court has left before its term ends this month
item.description: The justices have deadlocked on the legality of direct public funding for religious schools, upheld strict “ghost gun” regulations and narrowed the scope of environmental reviews for infrastructure projects. They will issue new rulings on Thursday, with decisions still pending on state bans of medical care for transgender teens, age verification for online porn, nationwide injunctions on banning birthright citizenship and more. Here are the cases.
